channel.title: [Tutorial] Easy To Use 'Compile-Then-Run' By: Ixl Adds Ixl
channel.description:
[u][b]Reminder[/b][/u] [b]I didn't know where to post this so it would be nice of you(Mod/GMod) if this was moved to the appropriate section of Moparscape, thanks. I posted this because recently I've been seeing many people who need help with compiling asking for this so I decided to come up with a solution to there problems.[/b]
[hr]
[u][b]Benefits[/b][/u] (S) Less horrifying problems with your compiler & run.bat/runserver.bat batch file. (S) Easy to use, all you do is click and your done, click > done.
[u][b]Feature[/b][/u] This program is basically easy to use. All you do is double click (or right click then click 'Open') it and this compiles your server first and secondly run it. Easy to use :D.
1) First open up your server source 2) Open your antilag.java file [IMG]http://i260.photobucket.com/albums/ii3/Ixl_photos/antilagfile.jpg[/img] and scroll down until you see the runserver() method that is shown below. [center][IMG]http://i260.photobucket.com/albums/ii3/Ixl_photos/runservermethod.jpg[/img][/center] 3) where it says [size=12pt][b]"[/b][/size]String run = "runserver.bat";[size=12pt][b]"[/b][/size] change that to [size=12pt][b]"[/b][/size]String run = "compile2run.bat";[size=12pt][b]"[/b][/size], save your file & of course close it.
4) Now were going to creat it! Open a notepad and paste this below: [code]echo off javac *.java java server pause[/code] [size=8pt]This code above is much easier to use instead of the directory one's, thats why I used those instead. They don't use a specific compiler, they use anyone available.[/size]
Now save the file as compile2run.bat - if you don't know where to put it there is a picture below to guide you: [center][IMG]http://i260.photobucket.com/albums/ii3/Ixl_photos/compile2runbatchfile.jpg[/img][/center]
5) Go back to your source & click the 'compile2run.bat' and you are done with this tutorial ;D. Congratulations :eek:!
[hr]
[u][b]Quick & easy guide for lazy people[/b][/u] [1] Open your source [2] Open run.bat(or runserver.bat if thats what your say) [3] Now paste this below: [code]echo off javac *.java java server pause[/code] [4] Now save your file [5] Go back to your source and run the .bat file we edited ;)
[u][b]Credits[/b][/u] 2008 copyright (c) of Sayyox Ltd. All rights reserved. Permission to use is accepted by anyone who uses. Authorization to copy or reproduce a product of Sayyox Ltd is not permitted.

item.title: [Tutorial] Easy To Use 'Compile-Then-Run' By: Ixl Adds Ixl
item.dc:creator: @Ixl_Adds_Ixl Ixl Adds Ixl
item.description:
@Ixl_Adds_Ixl wrote:

you can’t post batch file’s tutorials in tutorial section…

[quote=“Niall, post:1, topic:180919”]All of these rules apply.

Posting rules:
This section is ONLY for posting moparscape tutorials, and giving feedback to tutorials. This means, nothing but moparscape tutorials. No Java language tutorials. [sup]1[/sup]
No requests.
No 5 minute tutorials.
Tutorials MUST be written by you, and ONLY you.
Tutorials must be well written, and easy to read. They must also follow the Java Code Convention..
Only 1 tutorial on 1 subject, 2 tutorials on how to add woodcutting is NOT welcome.
Tutorials MUST teach something, no “replace x with y, and your done”.

Tutorials that AREN’T allowed:
Spawning items.
Commands.
NPC spawns.
[size=20pt]Anything to do with batch.[/size]
No training zones.

[sup]1[/sup]No “Java language tutorials” are allowed, this is specifically for private server tutorials. If you need a Java tutorial, why not use the Official Java tutorials? These tutorials will teach you most, if not everything you need to know about Java, from the concepts of OOP, to regex and exception handling.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: [Tutorial] Easy To Use 'Compile-Then-Run' By: Ixl Adds Ixl
item.dc:creator: @Ixl_Adds_Ixl Ixl Adds Ixl
item.description:
@Ixl_Adds_Ixl wrote:

Reminder
I didn’t know where to post this so it would be nice of you(Mod/GMod) if this was moved to the appropriate section of Moparscape, thanks. I posted this because recently I’ve been seeing many people who need help with compiling asking for this so I decided to come up with a solution to there problems.

[hr]

Benefits
(S) Less horrifying problems with your compiler & run.bat/runserver.bat batch file.
(S) Easy to use, all you do is click and your done, click > done.

Feature
This program is basically easy to use. All you do is double click (or right click then click ‘Open’) it and this compiles your server first and secondly run it. Easy to use :D.

  1. First open up your server source

  2. Open your antilag.java file and scroll down until you see the runserver() method that is shown below.
    [center][/center]

  3. where it says [size=12pt]"[/size]String run = “runserver.bat”;[size=12pt]"[/size] change that to [size=12pt]"[/size]String run = “compile2run.bat”;[size=12pt]"[/size], save your file & of course close it.

  4. Now were going to creat it! Open a notepad and paste this below:

echo off javac *.java java server pause
[size=8pt]This code above is much easier to use instead of the directory one’s, thats why I used those instead. They don’t use a specific compiler, they use anyone available.[/size]

Now save the file as compile2run.bat - if you don’t know where to put it there is a picture below to guide you:
[center][/center]

  1. Go back to your source & click the ‘compile2run.bat’ and you are done with this tutorial ;D. Congratulations :eek:!

[hr]

Quick & easy guide for lazy people
[1] Open your source
[2] Open run.bat(or runserver.bat if thats what your say)
[3] Now paste this below:

echo off javac *.java java server pause
[4] Now save your file
[5] Go back to your source and run the .bat file we edited

Credits
2008 copyright © of Sayyox Ltd. All rights reserved. Permission to use is accepted by anyone who uses. Authorization to copy or reproduce a product of Sayyox Ltd is not permitted.

Read full topic
